intro: Coleanthera myrtoides var. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower myrtlet, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
